It allows you to add multiple items to a single property.","slideImage":"umb://media/f1aee13d514d4b28bfd42a7b8dbf686b","slideLink":"[{\"name\":\"View Source Code\",\"target\":\"_blank\",\"url\":\"https://github.com/prjseal/CodeShare-Umbraco-Starter-Kit-for-v8/blob/master/src/CSUSK.Web/Views/Partials/Content/_MainCarousel.cshtml\",\"queryString\":\"\"}]"}]
home.metaDescription: CodeShare starter kit for Umbraco by Paul Seal from codeshare.co.uk
home.latestArticlesSubtitle: Here are some articles from the blog, you can use it as a blog or news. The articles are sorted by article date in descending order so the most recent ones show first.

content.contentGrid:
{"name":"1 column layout","sections":[{"grid":"12","rows":[{"name":"Full width","id":"aa3e8e0f-8db3-9f71-92b2-b946c6699997","areas":[{"grid":"12","controls":[{"value":"

It's here

The starter kit you have been waiting for is finally here. You are actually using it or viewing it now.

What is included?

In this starter kit you will see examples of how to do certain things in Umbraco such as:

  • A Bootstrap carousel using Nested Content in the backend.
  • A Bootstrap navigation menu with dropdowns.
  • Pretty links, you can create links as content items. See 'Links' in the navigation menu.
  • Contact form which uses Ajax
  • Simple search to help users find content on your site.

Want to learn more?

If you enjoy using this starter kit and would like to learn more about how I create Umbraco sites, visit my website codeshare.co.uk or check subscribe to my YouTube channel.

Want to thank me?

If you would like to thank me, why not buy me a coffee? It would be much appreciated and I will do my best to turn that coffee into code.

articleList.latestArticlesSubtitle: Here are some articles from the blog, you can use it as a blog or news. The articles are sorted by article date in descending order so the most recent ones show first.

article.metaDescription: The starter you have been waiting for is finally here. You are actually using it or viewing it now.

article.contentGrid:
{"name":"1 column layout","sections":[{"grid":"12","rows":[{"name":"Full width","id":"016855e6-d7c1-5a01-8dcd-bd9c2c1ee772","areas":[{"grid":"12","controls":[{"value":"

Hurray

The new cleaner and faster version of Umbraco has now been released for everyone to use.

What are the new features?

  • Runs on .NET 5 (.NET Core)
  • Runs on Windows, Mac, Linux etc
  • History Cleanup

You can find out more about the release of Umbraco v9 on the official Umbraco website.

If you want to know more about Umbraco v9 from a developer's perspective then check out this blog post.

article.metaDescription: Umbraco v8 is now released. Find out more about it here.

article.nodeName: CodeShare Starter Kit Updated for Umbraco v8
article.metaDescription: The CodeShare Starter Kit has been updated for Umbraco v8 with some improvements for performance.

GenericProperty.Name: Article Date
GenericProperty.Description: Choose a date for this article

GenericProperty.Name: Author Name
GenericProperty.Description: Enter a name for the author

GenericProperty.Name: Main Carousel
GenericProperty.Description: Add the items for the carousel

GenericProperty.Name: Slide Title
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the title for this slide

GenericProperty.Name: Slide Subtitle
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the subtitle for this slide

GenericProperty.Name: Slide Image
GenericProperty.Description: Add an image for this slide

GenericProperty.Name: Slide Link
GenericProperty.Description: Add a link for this slide to link to

GenericProperty.Name: Title
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the title for this page. If you leave this blank, we will use the page name.

GenericProperty.Name: Main Image
GenericProperty.Description: Choose an image to show as the main image on this page

GenericProperty.Name: Content Grid
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the content for the grid

GenericProperty.Name: Footer Title
GenericProperty.Description: Enter a title for the footer content

GenericProperty.Name: Footer Links
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the footer links

GenericProperty.Name: Footer Social Links
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the social links to show in the footer

GenericProperty.Name: Latest Articles Title
GenericProperty.Description: Enter a title for the latest articles

GenericProperty.Name: Latest Articles Subtitle
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the subtitle for the latest articles

GenericProperty.Name: Meta Name
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the meta name. If left blank it will use the page name.

GenericProperty.Name: Meta Description
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the meta description. This is what shows up in Google etc. If left blank, will use the page name.

GenericProperty.Name: Meta Keywords
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the meta keywords. This is used for Search Engine

GenericProperty.Name: Umbraco Navi Hide
GenericProperty.Description: Tick this box if you want to hide it from the site.

GenericProperty.Name: Disable Dropdown
GenericProperty.Description: Tick this box if you want to disable the dropdown for this item

GenericProperty.Name: Text Only In Navigation
GenericProperty.Description: Tick this box if you want this item to be just text only in the navigation menu.

GenericProperty.Name: Link Target
GenericProperty.Description: Enter the link for this pretty link to point to

GenericProperty.Name: Umbraco Url Alias
GenericProperty.Description: Enter an alternate url in here. Please note that the values you use must be lowercase, not use a leading slash and not use a trailing ".aspx" or trailing slash. If you are adding multiple values, they must be separated with a comma.

Template.Name: Contact
Master
Pretty Link
Search

PartialViews.View:
@inherits UmbracoViewPage
<title>@(Model.HasValue("metaName") ? Model.Value<string>("metaName") : Model.Name)</title> <meta name="Name" content="@(Model.HasValue("metaName") ? Model.Value<string>("metaName") : Model.Name)" /> <meta name="Description" content="@(Model.Value<string>("metaDescription"))" /> <meta name="Keywords" content="@(Model.HasValue("metaKeywords") ? string.Join(",", Model.Value<string[]>("metaKeywords")) : Model.Name)" />
